sentence.text: Like any man who turns a grudge into a crusade , Joyce 's alienation from reality grew more pitiful .
Once again , as if the distressed caller knew she was there , that pitiful high-pitched cry floated thinly over the uplands to her , and this time she saw from where and what it came .
It is pitiful to see the agony of a na√Øve dog that has nosed up too close to a skunk and been sprayed in the face .
But emotionally he was pitiful , held to ransom by an appalling wife .
The least he could do was offer the pitiful little man a possible escape by playing on his spurious temporary reputation as an authority figure .
A patch of dried blood showed on the top where it lay splayed out , and the sight was so pitiful that one of the children began to cry .
Urquhart had visited the dog in the stable where it slept , and was greeted with the pitiful sight of an animal which had lost control of itself .
` I was shown these two kids in a very pitiful state and I just could n't do nothing . "
But perhaps Joan 's greatest success came with a young man in the neuro-psychiatric unit who had been reduced to a pitiful existence as a result of a terrible motorcycle accident .
All around , thousands of their compatriots waited in pitiful food queues as the stench of raw sewage hung over Trnopolje .
THIS picture of a pitiful victim of the Serbs ' terror camps was taken by Liberal Democrat leader Paddy Ashdown .
Some lived for several days in this pitiful condition , their feet gnawed by dogs , until they died in agony .
She would not think of the pitiful remains in the corner .
I decided to go the house a few gardens away where a few pitiful meows brings some food from the woman .
The hand-outs were vital to get them a bite , to help them survive in their pitiful plight .
If she had come to a pitiful and desperate end , this woman for one would not be sorry .
